text.section:
The governing body of Baltimore County shall grant a property tax credit under this section against the county tax imposed on:
real property that is owned by the Harford Park Improvement Association of Baltimore County, Incorporated;
property that is:
owned by the Lynch Point Improvement Association, Incorporated, of River Drive in Baltimore County; and
used only for a community or civic purpose;
real property that is owned by the Chestnut Ridge Improvement Association of Baltimore County, Incorporated; and
property that is:
owned by the Relay Improvement Association of Baltimore County, Incorporated; and
used only for a community, civic, educational, recreational, or library purpose, if the use is not contingent on the payment of compensation, unless the compensation is used only to improve or maintain the property.

section.section:
A property owner is not eligible for a tax credit for agricultural land under subsection (b) of this section, and any such tax credit granted shall terminate, if the property owner:
sells an easement over the property to the State; or
terminates the agricultural preservation district agreement.

A property owner who has been granted a property tax credit for agricultural land under subsection (b) of this section, and who subsequently terminates the agricultural preservation district agreement shall be liable for:
all property taxes that the owner would have been liable for if a property tax credit had not been granted under this section for a period not exceeding 10 years from the date that the agricultural preservation agreement was recorded;
interest on the total tax liability as required under § 14-605 of this article; and
a tax penalty as required under § 14-703 of this article.

The governing body of Baltimore County or of a municipal corporation in Baltimore County may provide, by law, for:
the amount and duration of the property tax credit under this section; and
any other provision necessary to carry out the property tax credit under this section.
